alert.note: Alert for Laurens (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 09 at 5:57PM EDT until May 09 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following counties, Greenville and Laurens. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Nuisance to Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 553 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to slow-moving thunderstorms. Isolated areas from Mauldin to Simpsonville to Cooks Crossroads along SC 418 have received 1-2 inches of rainfall in an hour. An additional inch of rain is possible as these storms slowly drift south. Nuisance to Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the Advisory area. Expect rapid rises along streams, including Gilder Creek. This may cause flooding of common, flood-prone areas including Corn Rd near Mauldin High School. Please avoid flooded roadways. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Greenville Downtown, Greenville Eastside, West Greenville, Mauldin, Simpsonville, Five Forks, Fountain Inn and Donaldson Center.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
